page.title: 02BORDON GARRISON
page.content: The area around Bordon has been used as a training area for troops from Aldershot since the middle of the nineteenth century. In 1903 it was a garrison for troops awaiting demobilisation after the Boer War. It was connected to nearby Longmoor Camp by a Military Railway Training Centre providing local railway transport for civilians as well as military. After 1968 it became the Headquarters of the School of Electrical and Mechanical Engineering. Normally it is a short stay training area and the tour of duty is not more than two years. After training, troops are generally posted to Germany. The garrison is very much integrated into the life of the village. Indeed the village itself grew up as a service centre for the troops.
